ISSUE.TITLE: Container does not get automatically removed as specified by the --rm flag after failing due to a --publish port already in use

(leave only one on its own line)** /kind bug **Description** Container does not get automatically removed as specified by the __--rm__ flag after failing due to a __--publish__ port already in use. It works differently with Docker. After running the same command with Docker the container does not exist afterwards. (I'm not quite sure, maybe this is less of a bug and more of a feature request?) **Steps to reproduce the issue:** 1. ``` $ podman run -p 1200:80 --rm --name testing1 -d docker.io/library/nginx 7772ea10f1f2c925073ddac648f2f68e8bdfc73aca81bd13f14a5fcb9a8b5c51 $ podman run -p 1200:80 --rm --name testing2 -d docker.io/library/nginx Error: rootlessport listen tcp 0.0.0.0:1200: bind: address already in use $ podman container list -a | grep testing 7772ea10f1f2 docker.io/library/nginx:latest nginx -g daemon o... 30 seconds ago Up 31 seconds ago 0.0.0.0:1200->80/tcp testing1 846ce730ed18 docker.io/library/nginx:latest nginx -g daemon o... 18 seconds ago Created 0.0.0.0:1200->80/tcp testing2 $ ``` **Describe the results you received:** The container _testing2_ exists (as shown by the command ` podman container list -a `) **Describe the results you expected:** The container _testing2_ shouldn't exist. **Additional information you deem important (e.g. issue happens only
